dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Courtney (for himself, Mr. Himes, Mrs. Hayes, Mrs. Steel, and Mrs. Spartz) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Labor

form.official-title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to require reporting of certain incidents resulting in serious physical injuries or death at institutions of higher education, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the College Operational Reporting of Emergencies Involving Teens and Young Adults Safety Act of 2022 or the COREY Safety Act of 2022.

section.header: Extension of Clery Act to incidents resulting in serious physical injury or death

subsection.text: Section 485(f)(1)(F) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1092(f)(1)(F)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (ii), by striking and at the end;
in clause (iii), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: of incidents that result in serious physical harm or death involving—

subclause.text: transportation on foot or via bikes, scooters, skateboards, longboards, or motor vehicles;
ground level and high height slips and falls;

subsection.text: Section 485 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1092) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)(1)(O), by striking campus crime report and inserting campus safety report; and
in subsection (f)(1), by striking annual security report and inserting annual campus safety report.

subsection.text: Section 485(f)(1) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1092(f)(1)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: A statement including the name, address, and distance from campus of the Level I trauma center closest to the campus of the institution.
